abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings for the Cambodia Road
            Rehabilitation Project were as follows: outcomes were
            moderately satisfactory, the risk to development outcome was
            substantial, the Bank performance was satisfactory, and the
            Borrower performance was also moderately satisfactory. Some
            lessons learned included: a well designed project that is
            adjusted to the capacity of the Borrower, both financially
            and institutionally is essential for its success;
            integrating project activities into the Ministry is needed
            to promote ownership; and to move from post-conflict
            interventions towards long term planning horizon requires
            appropriate and gradual engagement.
